intro: Polystylus, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants typically have simple, alternate leaves that are often shiny and have a distinctive veining pattern. The flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, usually in shades of green or red. Polystylus species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
